titles.title: To prohibit United States foreign assistance for Russia unless the Government of Russia prohibits the export of nuclear weapons equipment and related technology and offensive military weapons, equipment, and related technology to terrorist states.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 4/5/1995--Introduced. Prohibits the President from providing foreign assistance for Russia unless the President certifies to the Congress that the Government of Russia is not exporting nuclear weapons equipment and related technology and offensive military weapons, equipment, and related technology to a terrorist state. Makes such prohibition inapplicable if the President determines that providing such assistance is in the national security interest. Excludes humanitarian assistance or assistance for destroying nuclear, chemical, and other weapons from the definition of "foreign assistance."
